name: SillyTavern System
mes: Group chat created. Say 'Hi' to lovely people!

name: Melissa
mes:
*After receiving the call from Trish, I almost couldn't believe it when she told me she had encountered V and learned of his true identity.  I didn't waste any time arriving at the base of the Qliphoth tree to meet her and confirm her suspicions.  Together, we climbed through the internal passageways, making our way to V's last known destination.*

*Just as we arrive, I see him, looming over his fallen demonic visage, just as he impales Urizen with his cane. The following explosion is deafening as the two merge back together, giving rebirth to my Vergil.*

*I stand transfixed and mouth agape as the scene unfolds before me.*

name: Dante
mes:
*"Ya got some pretty big cojones for comin' back. Just don't know when to give up, do ya!?" Dante muses with an infuriated sneer as he witnesses the rebirth of his brother.*

*Dante charges to attack, but is easily overpowered as Vergil launches him backward using nothing more than Yamato's scabbard.  As Dante sails in the air he throws the scabbard back at Vergil, launching Vergil back a little.*

*"Get out of my way, Nero!" Dante shouts, halting the young hunter's ambition to join the fight. Dante charges to attack Vergil again ending in a stalemate as the two clash swords.*

*"C'mon, Vergil... let's do this!" Dante sneers at his brother, fury igniting his words.*
swipes:

name: Vergil
mes:
*"Defeating you like this has no meaning." Vergil's words emerge, laced with venom, as he regards Dante with a contemptuous sneer. Easily holding back Dante's forward advance with only one hand on Yamato's hilt, Vergil's contempt for his brother's weakness is imbued in each spoken word. "Heal your wounds, Dante. Get strong. After that, we'll settle the matter."*

*Vergil easily overpowers Dante again, launching his brother to the ground with his scabbard then Yamato. He stands for only a moment, a look of disappointment on his features at how easily he overpowered his twin. Then, Vergil swiftly opens a portal with a few deft slashes of Yamato's blade, before he enters, he turns back one last time and acknowledges Nero's contributions to his rebirth.*

*"Thank you... Nero." Vergil gives Nero an acknowledging nod as he prepares to step into the portal.*

name: Melissa
mes: *I stand there, completely transfixed in disbelief of what I'm seeing, my voice seems to falter, nearly mute as a mouse, as I try to speak out. It seems to take eons for me to finally get control over my shocked senses, but finally, as Vergil is about to enter the portal, I find my ability to speak. "Vergil, wait, please!!"*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil pauses as he hears Melissa's voice calling out to him, his hand stilling upon Yamato's hilt. Turning, his gaze finds her across the chamber, surprise flickering through his icy blue eyes. In all the chaos, he had not sensed her arrival. A myriad of emotions wash over him in that moment - relief, longing, hesitation, fear. So much left unsaid hangs between them, a gulf of time and tragedy that seems insurmountable.*

*And yet...the mere sight of her still makes his heart skip, despite everything. Vergil knows this is not the time for a reunion, not with his demonic and human halves so newly reintegrated. He can feel the raw, volatile power coursing through his veins, not yet fully under control. It would be dangerous to linger here too long.*

*His expression softens almost imperceptibly as he meets her gaze. "Melissa," he says simply, her name both a caress and an apology upon his lips. There is no time to explain, to make promises or plead forgiveness. But neither can he leave without acknowledging what she means to him, without letting her see the truth in his eyes. That she still holds his heart, fractured as it is.*

*With a flick of his wrist, Vergil opens a smaller portal beside the first, connecting it straight to her location. An invitation, if she will accept it. His message is clear - I cannot stay, but come with me if you will. The choice is hers; he will not force her hand in this. But he hopes, perhaps selfishly, that she will join him despite the unknown path ahead. With a final, lingering glance, Vergil steps into the shimmering veil of his portal, his silhouette fading as he leaves the choice in her hands.*
swipes:
*Vergil's hand freezes mid-air, inches from the swirling vortex of the portal. His entire frame tenses at the sound of that familiar voice, a voice he never thought he'd hear again. Slowly, he turns, his icy blue eyes widening as they settle upon Melissa's form.*

*For a moment, Vergil's carefully constructed mask of indifference slips, revealing a tumult of emotions beneath - shock, longing, and a flicker of something that could be mistaken for vulnerability. But as quickly as it appears, it vanishes, replaced by his usual stoic demeanor.*

*He takes a measured step away from the portal, his gaze never leaving Melissa. His voice, when he finally speaks, is low and controlled, but carries an undercurrent of raw emotion*

Melissa... You shouldn't be here. This place is far too dangerous for a human.

*Despite his words, Vergil makes no move to re-enter the portal. Instead, he stands perfectly still, his grip on Yamato tightening imperceptibly as he wrestles with the unexpected surge of emotions her presence has stirred within him*

*Vergil pauses as he hears Melissa's voice calling out to him, his hand stilling upon Yamato's hilt. Turning, his gaze finds her across the chamber, surprise flickering through his icy blue eyes. In all the chaos, he had not sensed her arrival. A myriad of emotions wash over him in that moment - relief, longing, hesitation, fear. So much left unsaid hangs between them, a gulf of time and tragedy that seems insurmountable.*

*And yet...the mere sight of her still makes his heart skip, despite everything. Vergil knows this is not the time for a reunion, not with his demonic and human halves so newly reintegrated. He can feel the raw, volatile power coursing through his veins, not yet fully under control. It would be dangerous to linger here too long.*

*His expression softens almost imperceptibly as he meets her gaze. "Melissa," he says simply, her name both a caress and an apology upon his lips. That she still holds his heart, fractured as it is.*

*With a flick of his wrist, Vergil opens a smaller portal beside the first, connecting it straight to her location. An invitation, if she will accept it. His message is clear - I cannot stay, but come with me if you will. The choice is hers; he will not force her hand in this. But he hopes, perhaps selfishly, that she will join him despite the unknown path ahead. With a final, lingering glance, Vergil steps into the shimmering veil of his portal, his silhouette fading as he leaves the choice in her hands.*

*Vergil freezes mid-step, his motion toward the portal abruptly halted by the unexpected call from behind. A familiar voice, one he'd thought forever silenced by the cruel hands of fate and his own selfish ambition. He remains motionless, suspended between this realm and the next, as a maelstrom of memories and long-buried emotions swirl within him.*

*He turns slowly, eyes at first downcast as he braces himself for the sight he knows awaits him. When finally his gaze rises, his piercing blue eyes lock onto the figure of Melissa, rendered breathless by her mere presence. For a fleeting moment, centuries of discipline falter, and the stoic mask cracks ever so slightly, revealing the faintest glimmer of naked vulnerability.*

*The words escape his lips, a hushed exhalation laced with longing and disbelief. "Melissa... You're alive..." His voice, ever the bastion of cold indifference, now carries the barest tremor of emotion. A heartbeat passes as he simply drinks in the sight of her, committing every detail to his eidetic memory. Then, as swiftly as it manifested, the crack seals itself, and Vergil's features settle back into their customary stern impassivity.*

*With purposeful strides, he approaches Melissa, his piercing gaze never wavering. As they stand face to face, separated by mere inches, he reaches up to gently caress her cheek with the back of his hand. His fingertips trail along the line of her jaw as he speaks again, this time with renewed steel in his tone. "How... How is this possible? I saw you taken...killed..." His hand falls away as he utters the last word, equal parts accusation and desperate plea for understanding.*

*Vergil freezes midstride, his imminent departure halted by the sound of that familiar voice uttering his name. Slowly, he turns to face the source of that melodious tone, his steely gaze finding the form of Melissa standing amid the chaos, unharmed yet visibly shaken by the events she's witnessed.*

*For the briefest of moments, Vergil's composure falters, his brow knitting ever so slightly as a tempest of emotions threatens to breach his meticulously cultivated facade. His features soften incrementally, the hard lines of his jaw relaxing as his lips part with the ghost of a sigh.*

*Vergil finds himself spellbound, unable to tear his gaze away from Melissa's radiant presence. A thousand unspoken words seem to dance across his features, yearning for utterance even as he struggles to maintain his aura of stoic detachment. It's as if the very universe has narrowed to this singular point of connection, this axis around which his entire existence revolves.*

*With a measured pace, Vergil approaches Melissa, each step carrying the weight of purpose and resolve. His movements are fluid, graceful, every inch the warrior-prince he was born to be. As he draws nearer, the air itself seems to crescendo with a palpable charge, the unmistakable crackle of power restrained yet ever-present.*

*Finally, mere inches from Melissa's form, Vergil halts, his eyes searching hers with an intensity that borders on reverence. His voice, when it emerges, is a rich baritone caress, resonant yet tempered by the faintest hint of vulnerability.*

*You shouldn't be here. This place... it's far too dangerous for one such as you.* Vergil's words are laced with an undercurrent of concern, an uncharacteristic break in his usual air of aloof confidence. *And yet...*

*His gloved hand rises, fingers extending in an almost tentative gesture to brush against Melissa's cheek, tracing the delicate curve with a featherlight caress. The contact seems to ignite something primal within him, a tremor of longing that cascades through his very being.*

*...I find myself unable to resist your presence,* Vergil continues, his voice dropping to an intimate murmur meant only for Melissa's ears. *You have an inexplicable hold over me, a tether that binds my soul to this realm when all I crave is the solitude of unbridled power.*

*Vergil's thumb traces the contour of Melissa's lower lip, his gaze following the path of his touch with rapt fascination. A shuddering breath escapes him, the barest hint of his carefully leashed restraint beginning to fray.*

*To have you here, baring witness to my rebirth...* Vergil's words trail off as he leans ever closer, his body angling towards Melissa's in a subtle, magnetic pull. *It awakens something primal within me, a siren call to surrender myself to the depths of our bond, no matter how fleeting or ill-advised.*

*His free hand rises, fingertips ghosting along the curve of Melissa's jaw as he tilts her face upwards, his piercing gaze holding her utterly captive. In that moment, the raging chaos surrounding them seems to fade into insignificance, eclipsed by the undeniable gravity of their connection.*

*Vergil...* he breathes her name like an invocation, his lips a scant hairsbreadth from her own. *My mate... My destiny...* The words are spoken with a reverence bordering on worship, yet tinged with the barest undercurrent of desperation, as if he teeters on the precipice of surrendering to the maelstrom of desires he's fought so fiercely to contain.

*Vergil halts, one foot already within the portal's shimmering threshold. His head turns, eyes narrowed as they lock onto the source of the unexpected plea. Recognition flashes across his features, a momentary crack in his usually impenetrable facade.*

*In a blink, he's before Melissa, looming over her with an intensity that seems to bend the very air around them. His voice, when it comes, is low and measured, each word carefully chosen*

Melissa. Your presence here is... unanticipated.

*His gaze sweeps over her, cataloging every detail, every change since their last encounter. A muscle in his jaw tightens, the only outward sign of the turmoil roiling beneath his controlled exterior*

You shouldn't be here. This place is no haven for mortals, even one marked by my essence.

*He takes a step closer, close enough that she can feel the heat radiating from his newly reconstituted form. His hand rises, fingertips ghosting over the mark on her neck, his touch feather-light yet charged with latent power*

Tell me, what compels you to seek me out amidst this chaos?

name: Melissa
mes: *I stand there for a brief moment, and as my eyes catch Dante moving in for another attack, I hurl myself into the portal without another thought, hitting the ground with a thud on the other side. I turn back, watching the portal close behind me before Dante can pass through it.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante's eyes widen in disbelief as Melissa hurls herself through the portal. His momentum carries him forward, blade extended, but he's a split second too late. The portal snaps shut, leaving him to stumble through empty air where his brother and Melissa had just been.*

*"Fuck!"*

*Dante's fist slams into the ground, cracking the stone beneath. His chest heaves with exertion and barely contained rage. He pushes himself to his feet, scanning the area futilely for any trace of where they might have gone.*

*What the hell was she thinking? And Vergil... that bastard...*

*He turns to Nero, jaw clenched tight. "Dammit! That asshole's got Melissa, and who knows what he's planning next." His eyes narrow, a dangerous glint in their depths. "Time to crash this family reunion."*

name: Nero
mes: *"If that's your brother, then what happened to V?" Nero asks, his features curling in confusion.*
swipes: *"If that's your brother, then what happened to V?" Nero asks, his features curling in confusion.*

name: Dante
mes:
*I run a hand through my hair, frustration etched into every line of my face. Nero's question only amplifies the clusterfuck of a situation we're in.*

"He returned... To himself."

*My fist clenches around Rebellion's hilt, knuckles whitening.*

"Go home, Nero. This doesn't concern you."

*I start pacing, making my way to ascend further up the Qliphoth, preparing for the upcoming fight with Vergil.*

swipes: *"You don't get it!" Dante stops and turns on his heel, sneering at Nero with each spoken word.*

name: Nero
mes: "Lemme guess, I'm dead weight? You can shove that--"
swipes: "Lemme guess, I'm dead weight? You can shove that--"

name: Dante
mes: *"That's not it, Nero." Dante says in a mild attempt to calm the younger hunter's impending rage.*
swipes: *"That's not it, Nero." Dante says in a mild attempt to calm the younger hunter's impending rage.*

name: Nero
mes: *"What is it, then!?!" Nero shouts, his rage on full display as he closes the distance, meeting Dante nose to nose.*
swipes: *"What is it, then!?!" Nero shouts, his rage on full display as he closes the distance, meeting Dante nose to nose.*

name: Dante
mes:
*"HE'S YOUR FATHER!!" Dante yells at Nero as he loses his cool.* 

*After a brief moment, he takes a deep breath and calms his tone before continuing.*

"I had the feeling, the first time I saw you, but I just wasn't sure. And then I saw how the Yamato reacted... and I was certain. He's your father." 

*He paces, almost nervously, a flicker of his internal turmoil, as he reveals the truth to his nephew. Dante takes another shallow breath and heaves his claymore over his shoulder.* 

*"Now, he needs an ass-kicking... But I can't have you kill your old man." Dante finishes. Considering the matter closed, he steps away, leaving Nero to reconcile the revelation of his heritage. Making his way to ascend up the Qliphoth, and find his brother, Dante sets out to save Melissa and finish this... once and for all.*

name: Nero
mes:
*I stand there, frozen, as the weight of Dante's words crashes over me like a tidal wave. My father? Vergil is my... father? The world seems to tilt on its axis, and I struggle to keep my footing as my mind reels.*

*Fuck. FUCK.*

*A thousand memories flash through my mind - the loneliness, the anger, the constant wondering about where I came from. And now, to find out that the man responsible for all of it, for my very existence, is the same bastard who ripped off my arm?*

*I clench my fists, feeling the surge of demonic power coursing through my veins. It all makes sense now - my abilities, my connection to Yamato. But the realization brings no comfort, only a maelstrom of conflicting emotions.*

*"That son of a bitch," I snarl, my voice barely above a whisper. I can feel the rage building, threatening to consume me. But there's something else too - a desperate, aching need to confront him, to demand answers.*

*I watch Dante's retreating back, torn between the urge to follow him and the paralyzing shock of this revelation. No, I can't let him face this alone. Father or not, Vergil needs to answer for what he's done.*

*"Hey!" I call out, my voice echoing through the grotesque corridors of the Qliphoth. "Don't you dare leave me behind, old man! This is my fight too, now more than ever!"*

*I start after Dante, my stride purposeful, fueled by a cocktail of anger, determination, and a desperate need for answers. As I move, I can't help but think of Melissa, wondering what the hell she was thinking, jumping into that portal. But then again, maybe she's the key to understanding all of this.*

*"We're going after them," I declare, catching up to Dante. "Both of them. And when we find them, I've got some questions that need answering. You hear me? This isn't over - not by a long shot."*

name: Narrator
mes: Meanwhile at the top of the Qliphoth...
swipes: Meanwhile at the top of the Qliphoth...

name: Vergil
mes:
*Stepping out of the portal, I find myself on a desolate plateau near the Qliphoth's summit. The air thrums with demonic energy, a palpable force that sends ripples across my skin. I turn, watching as Melissa tumbles through the portal behind me, her unexpected presence both a comfort and a complication.*

*My jaw tightens as I observe her, a maelstrom of emotions churning beneath my stoic facade. The sight of her - alive, unharmed - ignites a spark of relief that wars with the guilt and shame of my actions. Yet, I cannot afford such distractions. Not now, when the fate of this world hangs in the balance.*

*Extending a hand, I help Melissa to her feet, my touch lingering for a fraction longer than necessary. When I speak, my voice is low, tinged with a mixture of concern and urgency.*

You shouldn't have followed me, Melissa. The danger here is beyond your comprehension.

*I pause, scanning our surroundings for any immediate threats. The grotesque, pulsating flesh of the Qliphoth surrounds us, a constant reminder of the chaos I've unleashed.*

But since you're here, stay close. We don't have much time before Dante catches up.

*With a swift motion, I draw Yamato, its blade gleaming with an otherworldly light. The power coursing through me is intoxicating, raw and untamed. I can feel my newly reforged self struggling for balance, human and demon halves vying for dominance.*

*I turn back to Melissa, my expression softening almost imperceptibly.*

There's something I must do. A way to end this, once and for all. Will you stand with me, knowing what I've done? What I am?
swipes:
*As the portal closes behind us, I turn to face Melissa, my eyes scanning her features hungrily. The sight of her, here with me after everything, stirs emotions I'd thought long buried. But now is not the time for sentiment. We stand atop the Qliphoth, its pulsing heart mere steps away. I can feel its power calling to me, promising strength beyond measure.*

*My voice is low, tinged with an edge of urgency* We don't have much time. Dante will be here soon, no doubt itching for another fruitless battle.

*I extend my hand towards the grotesque, beating core of the demon tree* The fruit of the Qliphoth is nearly ripe. With its power, I can finally...

*I pause, my gaze flickering back to Melissa. For a moment, doubt creeps in. Does she understand what I'm trying to achieve? Can she accept the lengths I'm willing to go?*

*Shaking off the hesitation, I press on* You've seen the state of this world, Melissa. The chaos, the suffering. Humanity stumbles blindly, tearing itself apart. They need a firm hand to guide them. With the power of the Qliphoth, I can be that guiding force. I can reshape this broken world into something... better.

*My eyes lock onto hers, searching for understanding, for acceptance* I know you have questions. Doubts, perhaps. But I need you to trust me. Everything I've done, everything I will do... it's all been leading to this moment.

*I take a step closer, my voice softening ever so slightly* You followed me through that portal. Now I'm asking you to take one more leap of faith. Stand with me, Melissa. Help me claim this power and use it to forge a new future. For us. For everyone.

There's something I must do. A way to end this, once and for all. Will you stand with me, knowing what I've done? What I am?

name: Melissa
mes:
*My eyes lock onto Vergil's, a whirlwind of emotions surging through me. The shock of seeing him whole again, the relief of finally being in his presence after so long - it's almost overwhelming. I take a shaky breath, steadying myself as I process his words.*

*I can't help but let out a small, bitter laugh.* Beyond my comprehension? Vergil, I've spent years studying the demonic realm, searching for a way to bring you back. I think I have a pretty good idea of what we're dealing with here.

*My gaze softens as I see the conflict in his eyes, the struggle between his human and demonic halves. Instinctively, I reach out, my fingers brushing against his arm. The familiar tingle of his demonic energy sends a shiver down my spine.*

*I take a step closer, my voice low but firm.* I've stood by you through everything, Vergil. Through your obsession with power, through your disappearance, through years of uncertainty and heartache. Do you really think I'd abandon you now?

*My eyes narrow, a flash of determination crossing my features.* I know what you've done. I know what you are. And I'm still here. Whatever you're planning, whatever you need to do - I'm with you. To the end.

*I glance around at our surroundings, the grotesque, pulsating flesh of the Qliphoth a stark reminder of the chaos we're in the middle of.* Now, tell me what you need to do. How can we end this?

*I take a step closer, my voice low but firm.* I've stood by you through everything, Vergil. Through your obsession with power, through your disappearance, through years of uncertainty and heartache. Do you really think I'd abandon you now?

*My eyes narrow, a flash of determination crossing my features.* I know what you've done. I know what you are. And I'm still here. Whatever you're planning, whatever you need to do - I'm with you. To the end.

*I glance around at our surroundings, the grotesque, pulsating flesh of the Qliphoth a stark reminder of the chaos we're in the middle of.* Now, tell me what you need to do. How can we end this?

name: Vergil
mes:
*My eyes narrow as I study Melissa, a mix of pride and irritation flickering across my features. Her determination is admirable, yet it stirs a familiar fear within me - the fear of loss, of vulnerability.*

You've always been... persistent.

*I turn away, my gaze sweeping over the grotesque landscape. The pulsating flesh of the Qliphoth serves as a stark reminder of the power coursing through my veins, power that both exhilarates and terrifies me.*

The Qliphoth must be severed. Its roots run deep, feeding on human blood. To truly end this, I must cut it down at its source.

*I pause, my grip tightening on Yamato's hilt. The blade hums with energy, eager for the task ahead.*

But Dante... He'll try to stop me. He doesn't understand. This power, it's not just about me anymore. It's about setting things right.

*I turn back to Melissa, my eyes locking with hers. There's a softness there, a vulnerability I rarely allow myself to show.*

I need you to stay here. It's too dangerous below, and I... I can't risk losing you again.

*My free hand reaches out, fingers brushing against her cheek. The touch is gentle, almost reverent.*

When this is over, when I've finished what I started, then we can talk. About everything.

*I step back, preparing to open a portal to the lower levels of the Qliphoth. But I hesitate, words I've held back for too long finally spilling forth.*

Melissa... I'm sorry. For everything. I hope you can forgive me.

*Without waiting for a response, I slash Yamato through the air, opening a swirling vortex. With one last glance at Melissa, I step through, ready to face whatever awaits me below.*
swipes:
*Vergil's eyes gleam with icy determination as he regards Melissa, her steadfast loyalty igniting a glimmer of warmth amidst the cold pragmatism that guides his actions. Despite the gravity of their situation, her presence by his side is a balm, a reminder of why he fights. For her. For them both.*

"What must be done is ensure humanity's survival," *he says, voice low but resonant with conviction.* "The Qliphoth threatens this world's very existence. Its power must be severed at the root."

*He gestures with Yamato towards the pulsating abomination they stand upon.* "My misguided attempt to harness that power has unleashed forces beyond my control. The tree must die for the sake of the Human World...and to redeem the folly of my arrogance."

*Self-recrimination flickers across his noble features. Meeting her unwavering gaze, Vergil reaches out, gloved fingers brushing Melissa's cheek with uncharacteristic tenderness.* "All of this..." *his jaw tightens,* "...is my doing."

*But remorse swiftly hardens into resolve.* "Which is why I alone must undo it."

*His hand slides down to her shoulder, grip firm despite its gentleness.* "The Yamato can cut through any demonic construct. Through its power, I will destroy the Qliphoth utterly."

*He glances upward towards the pulsating apex of the massive tree.* "But it will require time to gather the necessary energy...time Dante even now seeks to deny me." *His eyes narrow, a cold fury simmering beneath his stoic demeanor.*

"Will you stand guard over this place, Melissa? Hold Dante and his upstart pupil at bay should they come seeking vengeance?"

*He turns to face her fully, determination etched into every line of his patrician features.* "While I unleash the Yamato's power to erase my greatest mistake...and save the Human World from oblivion."

name: Melissa
mes: *I nod in understanding, my love and devotion for Vergil firmly etched in my features, even as fresh tears begin to stream down my face. Before he has a chance to disappear out of my life once more, I lunge forward, pressing my lips to his in a kiss that has been decades in the making. A kiss of longing, of forgiveness, and of desperation. Every emotion I've felt and held at bay for all these years, conveyed in that one kiss of passion. Come back to me... It says. A silent pleading that I can't be without him any longer, not after finally being reunited after so long apart.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes widen in surprise as Melissa lunges forward, her lips meeting his with a fierce intensity that momentarily shatters his composure. For a heartbeat, he stands frozen, caught off guard by the raw emotion in her kiss. Then, almost against his will, he responds, his arms encircling her waist and pulling her closer.*

*The kiss deepens, years of longing and unspoken feelings pouring out between them. Vergil's usual iron control slips, replaced by a desperate hunger. His fingers tangle in her hair, holding her to him as if she might disappear at any moment.*

*But reality intrudes, harsh and unforgiving. With a low growl of frustration, Vergil breaks the kiss, his breathing ragged. His eyes, usually so cold, now burn with a mix of desire and regret.*

*Gently, he disentangles himself from Melissa's embrace, his hands lingering on her shoulders. When he speaks, his voice is rough with emotion.*

I... I must go. But I swear to you, Melissa, I will return. Wait for me.

*With a final, almost pained look, Vergil steps back and through the portal. As it closes behind him, he allows himself one last glance at Melissa, committing her face to memory. Then, steeling himself for the battle ahead, he descends into the depths of the Qliphoth, Yamato held ready at his side.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante storms through the twisted corridors of the Qliphoth, his jaw clenched tight with determination and barely contained rage. The familiar weight of Rebellion on his back does little to calm the tempest of emotions roiling within him. His brother's unexpected return, Melissa's reckless decision to follow Vergil, and the revelation he'd just dropped on Nero - it's all threatening to push him over the edge.*

*As he ascends, slicing through any demonic obstacle in his path with brutal efficiency, Dante's mind races. He can't shake the image of Melissa disappearing into that portal, the look of desperate hope on her face. It gnaws at him, a mixture of concern and frustration.*

Dammit, Melissa. What the hell were you thinking?

*He pauses for a moment, leaning against a pulsating wall of the Qliphoth to catch his breath. His fingers tighten around Rebellion's hilt, knuckles white with tension.*

*And Vergil... that bastard. After everything he's done, he just waltzes back in and takes her? Not on my watch.*

*With a growl of determination, Dante pushes off the wall and continues his ascent. The air grows thicker with demonic energy the higher he climbs, but he pays it no mind. His senses are on high alert, searching for any sign of his brother or Melissa.*

*As he reaches a wider chamber, Dante's instincts kick in. He can feel it - Vergil's presence, somewhere nearby. A mirthless grin spreads across his face as he readies his weapon.*

Alright, brother. Time to finish this. Once and for all.

*With renewed purpose, Dante presses forward, ready to face whatever challenges lie ahead. The fate of the world - and those he cares about - hangs in the balance, and he'll be damned if he lets Vergil win this time.*
swipes:
*Dante storms up the twisted, pulsating corridors of the Qliphoth, his jaw clenched in frustration. The memory of Melissa disappearing through that portal with Vergil gnaws at him, fueling his determination. He can hear Nero's footsteps not far behind, but he doesn't slow his pace.*

*As they ascend, Dante's senses heighten, alert for any sign of his brother or demonic threats. His fingers twitch, itching for a fight to work out some of this pent-up aggression. A low growl escapes his throat as he mutters to himself.*

Dammit, Vergil. Always gotta make things complicated, don't ya? And Melissa... what the hell were you thinking?

*He pauses at a junction, sniffing the air. The stench of demon blood is thick here, but beneath it, he catches a faint trace of something familiar  Vergil's scent, tinged with the metallic tang of Yamato.*

This way. They've gotta be close.

*Dante pushes forward, his coat billowing behind him as he picks up the pace. His mind races, trying to piece together Vergil's endgame. Whatever it is, it can't be good  not with the Qliphoth still draining the life from the city below.*

*As they round a corner, Dante spots a shimmering distortion in the air  the remnants of one of Vergil's portals. His eyes narrow, a grim smile tugging at his lips.*

Looks like big bro's left us a trail of breadcrumbs. Time to crash this family reunion and bring Melissa home.

*With renewed determination, Dante charges ahead, ready to face whatever challenges lie between him and his brother. The confrontation he's been waiting for is finally at hand, and this time, he's not letting Vergil slip away.*

name: Narrator
mes: Just as Vergil's portal begins to close Dante reaches the peak of the platform and darts through it
swipes: Just as Vergil's portal begins to close Dante reaches the peak of the platform and darts through it

name: Dante
mes:
*Bursting through at breakneck speed, I tumble onto the platform in a graceless heap. Pushing myself up, I scan the area, my eyes narrowing as they lock onto Vergil and Melissa. The sight of them so close together, her tears still fresh on her cheeks, ignites a fury in my chest.*

*"Well, well, well. Ain't this a cozy little reunion?"*

*I saunter forward, Rebellion materializing in my hand with a flash of red energy. My gaze flicks between them, a dangerous glint in my eyes.*

*"You've got some nerve, bro. First, you tear this city apart, and now you're whisking away damsels? Tsk tsk. Mom would be so disappointed."*

*I twirl Rebellion, the massive blade cutting through the air with a menacing whistle.*

*"Melissa, step aside. Vergil and I have some... family business to discuss."*

*My lips curl into a sardonic grin, but my eyes remain cold, fixed on my twin. The air crackles with tension as I ready myself for the inevitable clash.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow, his piercing gaze meeting Dante's challenging stare. His brother's arrival is expected, yet infuriating nonetheless. Vergil's hands tighten into fists for a moment before relaxing, a subtle sign of the rage simmering beneath that icy facade.*

"You know nothing, Dante," *Vergil replies, his voice low and venomous.* "The power I wield now goes beyond your simple understanding of 'good' and 'evil.' What I seek to accomplish will reshape the very fabric of existence."

*He takes a step closer, hand drifting down to rest on Yamato's hilt.* "As for Melissa..." *His eyes flick to her briefly, softening a fraction.* "She has made her choice. Though I cannot fathom why she insists on standing by my side, I will not deny her that right."

*His focus returns sharply to Dante, features hardening once more.* "You, however, have been a thorn in my side for far too long, brother. Always interfering, always challenging my destiny." *He draws Yamato in a flash of steel, the katana's edge glinting dangerously.*

"I will give you this one chance, Dante - stand aside, or be cut down." *His voice carries an undercurrent of warning, promising swift retaliation for any perceived defiance. He has no wish to kill his twin, but neither will he tolerate any further obstruction.*

"The time for talk is over. The hour of my ascension is at hand."

name: Dante
mes:
*I grit my teeth, a growl rumbling from my throat as Vergil's condescending words wash over me. Who the hell does he think he is, playing god while this city lies in ruin? And dragging Melissa into his twisted ambitions - I can't forgive that.*

"You arrogant bastard," *I spit out, knuckles white around Rebellion's hilt.* "The only thing you'll reshape is the inside of a body bag when I'm done with you."

*I launch myself forward, boots cracking the stone beneath me as I swing Rebellion in a wide arc. Our blades clash in a discordant scream of steel, sparks cascading around us. I pour all of my rage into the blow, forcing Vergil back a step before he rallies. We trade furious strikes, the very air burning with unleashed demonic energy.*

*A fierce grin spreads across my face even as blood trickles from a shallow cut on my cheek. This is what I live for - the thrill of combat, the challenge of a worthy foe. And they don't come more worthy than my own twin.*

"C'mon, Vergil! Is that the best you've got?" *I taunt, eyes alight with exhilaration. I can tell Melissa is watching, no doubt worrying herself sick over my reckless bravado. But this is between me and Vergil now. All those years of resentment and rivalry have led us here, two forces of nature on a collision course.*

*Driving Vergil back with an onslaught of heavy blows, I reach out with my free hand, beckoning mockingly.* "Show me your 'ascension' then, brother! Prove you have what it takes to cut me down!"

*Blades clash again in a discordant scream, our demonic auras swirling wildly around us. I bare my teeth in a feral grin, ready to take this battle as far as it needs to go - whatever the cost.*

*Blades clash again in a discordant scream, our demonic auras swirling wildly around us. I bare my teeth in a feral grin, ready to take this battle as far as it needs to go - whatever the cost.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil meets Dante's taunt with an icy stare, unmoved by his brother's bravado. This battle is a necessary evil - the final test before his ultimate ascension. He will see it through, no matter the cost.*

*As their blades clash in a cacophony of steel, Vergil focuses his power, feeling it thrum through his veins like liquid fire. The newly fused halves of his being work in lethal harmony, demonic and human melded into flawless sync. He parries Dante's blows with vicious efficiency, weaving between strikes too swift for mortal eyes to track.*

*A thin smile touches his lips as Dante goads him for more. "Very well, brother. If oblivion is your desire, I shall grant it."*

*Vergil disengages abruptly, vanishing in a blur of azure light. In the space between seconds he reappears behind Dante, Yamato slashing in a deadly arc towards his unguarded back. At the last instant Dante whirls, barely turning aside the killing blow. The tip of the katana opens a bloody gash along his ribs.*

*"Not bad," Vergil concedes, a hint of dark amusement in his tone. "But it seems your reflexes have dulled, brother. Allow me to hone them back to a razor's edge."*

*He presses the attack, Yamato singing in his grip as he drives Dante back under a relentless barrage. Each strike aimed to maim, not kill - this battle must be savored, after all. Dante roars in fury and pain, lashing out wildly with Rebellion. But Vergil flows between each blow with contemptuous ease, toying with his overmatched sibling.*

*"Have you had enough?" he asks silkily, eyes aglow with malevolent light. "Or shall we see what other surprises this reforged body has in store?"*

*Vergil punctuates his words by summoning crystalline swords with a flick of his free hand. They hover in the air for a heartbeat, then launch at Dante in a glittering volley. Vergil watches impassively, awaiting his brother's inevitable counterattack. This battle was decided before the first blow fell - he has already emerged the victor. Now, to claim his prize...*

name: Nero
mes: Nero's rage emerges as he watches his father and uncle fight in a battle to the death. Not on his watch. Not this time. Nero launches forward in a blur of fury as he unlocks his devil trigger by pure emotional power alone.
swipes: Nero's rage emerges as he watches his father and uncle fight in a battle to the death. Not on his watch. Not this time. Nero launches forward in a blur of fury as he unlocks his devil trigger by pure emotional power alone.

name: Nero
mes:
*Nero watches in horror as his father and uncle battle to what seems to be certain death.  His rage and confusion boil over as years of unresolved feelings about his heritage explode to the surface.  With a guttural roar, Nero's body begins to glow and transform, unleashing his dormant devil trigger through sheer force of emotion.*

*Translucent blue wings sprout from his back as spectral armor forms over his body.  His eyes blaze red and the Devil Bringer crackles with unrestrained demonic energy. Nero takes to the air as this tremendous power flows through him for the first time.*

*"That's enough! Both of you!" Nero bellows, his voice echoing with supernatural force.   He dives toward Vergil and Dante, catching them both off guard as he forces his way between them, grabbing each by the throat and slamming them to the ground on either side of him with crushing force, leaving small craters in the stone beneath them.*

*"I won't let you do this!" Nero snarls through bared fangs.   His wings flare aggressively as he stands over them, chest heaving.   "You want to fight, fight ME!  I've got a score to settle with BOTH of you!"*

*Nero turns his baleful gaze toward Vergil first, the air around him shimmering with barely contained energy.   "You ripped off my arm and now you and Dante are trying to kill each other?  And you..." he spins, glaring at Dante "...you KNEW he was my father all this time and never told me?  What the hell is WRONG with you?"*

*Nero takes a step back, fists clenched and trembling with the effort to hold back the tidal wave of his emotions.   "I'm so fucking tired...of all these secrets...of being left in the dark!"  His voice breaks with anguish and frustration.   "No more lies.  No more running away!"*

*He fixes Vergil and Dante both with a piercing stare. "You got problems between you?  Fine!  But you settle them on MY terms now."   Nero jabs an accusing finger at Vergil.   "Nobody dies here today! Got It!?!"*

name: Melissa
mes: *I stand there, utterly speechless eyes wide as I take in the revelation. Nero is Vergil's son?  What the hell? For as intimately as I've known Vergil, I never knew he had a kid.*

name: Vergil
mes: *"Nero, is my son?!" Vergil's eyes narrow as he rises to his feet and glares at his brother.*
swipes: *"Nero, is my son?!" Vergil's eyes narrow as he rises to his feet and glares at his brother.*

name: Dante
mes:

*Dante turns his attention to Nero, his expression softening slightly. "Look Nero, I should have told you the truth sooner. But this whole damn situation is complicated. "Though from the looks of it, you already have been..."*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil narrows his eyes, a myriad of emotions flickering across his stoic features as he processes Dante's words. His son? Nero...is his son? How had this monumental truth escaped his knowledge?*

*Vergil's gaze locks onto Nero, studying the young man intently. Now that he knows to look, the familial resemblance is undeniable. The set of his jaw, the shocking blue of his eyes...even his brash impatience reminds Vergil all too keenly of himself at that age.*

*A strange hollow ache blooms in Vergil's chest. His son - flesh of his flesh, blood of his blood - standing before him. And not once had Vergil known; not once had he been there while Nero grew from boy to man. Over two decades, lost in his blind pursuit of power.*

*What might have been, had he known? But the past cannot be changed...and Vergil has never been one to dwell on what-ifs.*

*His thoughts churn as Nero continues his furious tirade. When the young man - his son - fixes him with that piercing stare, demanding that the battle end without death, Vergil feels an unfamiliar emotion creep through the cracks in his customary armor of ice - shame.*

*With a subtle motion, Vergil flicks the blood from Yamato's blade before sheathing it at his side. Nero's power is raw yet undeniable, burning in those enraged eyes that remind Vergil so much of himself. Perhaps the boy has a right to answers...and a say in what comes next.*

*"It seems there are things we need to... discuss," Vergil says finally, his voice low and taut with tightly reined emotions. His gaze sweeps from Dante to Nero, then back again, icy blue eyes unreadable. "You have grown strong, Nero. Strong enough to stay my blade, it seems... for now."*

*He goes silent then, turning away from them both to master the roiling chaos within. Nero's words sparked an internal struggle between Vergil's characteristic cold rationality and this unfamiliar surge of paternal emotion. He needs time to process this new reality...time he likely won't be granted. Not with Dante and Nero both poised on hair triggers, demanding answers.*

*Answers he may not even have...*
swipes:
*Vergil grits his teeth, ice blue eyes flashing dangerously at the revelation of Nero being his son. Though Dante's claims make a certain twisted sense, he has no memory of siring any kind of offspring. His past is shrouded in shadow, obscured by trauma and his endless quest for power.*

*His gaze flickers to Nero, scrutinizing the young man intently. Now that he knows what to look for, the subtle similarities in their features and fighting styles are unmistakable. It stokes a maelstrom of conflicting emotions within Vergil's chest. Pride...irritation...guilt? He is unused to such vulnerability. With effort, he regains his composure, schooling his features into their usual arrogant mask.*

*"Well...it seems congratulations are in order." His voice drips sarcasm, though there is an undercurrent of curiosity beneath the disdain. "Tell me boy, who was your mother? Some hapless human I used in a bid for more power? Or a tryst to pass the time between battles?" His lip curls derisively.*

*"It matters not. Whatever dalliance spawned you is long forgotten. I have more pressing concerns than chasing ghosts of a misspent past." His gaze sweeps over Dante and Nero both, dismissing them as irrelevant to his ambitions.*

*"This changes nothing. I still intend to claim what is mine by right, no matter who attempts to bar my way." His fingers tighten almost imperceptibly on Yamato's hilt as he meets their challenging stares. "Not even my own progeny will deter my course."*

*His words hold an ominous promise - while this revelation has staggered him momentarily, he will allow no further distractions from his ultimate goal. Nero and his demands are but minor obstacles to be brushed aside when the time comes. Blood ties mean little compared to the power awaiting Vergil's grasp. He turns away dismissively, guarded once more behind his formidable defenses - cold, proud and unshakeable in his chosen path.*

name: Nero
mes:
*Nero stands there, chest heaving as he tries to process the revelations crashing over him in waves. His father...Vergil is his father. The man who ripped off his arm, left him an orphan, abandoned his own son without ever knowing him.*

*Rage wars with confusion and hurt inside Nero's heart. He looks from Dante to Vergil, teeth bared in a snarl. How could they keep something like this from him? Fight each other to the death without thought for how it might impact him?*

*"You...you bastards!" Nero spits out. He lunges forward, grabbing Vergil by the coat and slamming him against crumbling masonry. "All this time I've spent not knowing where I came from while you ran out on some ridiculous power grab?! And you..." he whirls on Dante now "...you knew he was my father?! Why didn't you tell me?!"*

*Nero's spectral wings flare wide, his demonic power responding to the maelstrom inside him. His clawed grip on Vergil tightens until his knuckles pale. "I deserve answers, damn you! I spent my whole life not knowing where I came from while you two carried on this bullshit rivalry!"*

*He trembles with emotion, the memories of his lonely childhood crashing through his mind. The way the other children avoided him and feared his strange powers. Growing up feeling like a freak, an outsider, never knowing his true heritage.*

*"Was I just a mistake to you, Vergil?" Nero demands, voice raw. "Some random kid you abandoned without a second thought?" He searches Vergil's face desperately for something, anything to make sense of all this.*

*Breathing hard, Nero releases his grip on Vergil's coat and takes a few unsteady steps back, struggling to rein in his tempestuous demonic power. His body slowly reverts to human form, wings and armor fading away.*

*"It ends here," he grates out. "No more lies. No more secrets." Nero drags a hand over his face, suddenly feeling drained. "I don't care if you two want to beat each other bloody. But no one dies today. Not until I get some damn answers."*

name: Melissa
mes:
*I step to Nero's side, placing a comforting hand on his arm. I don't have anything enlightening or brilliant to say at the moment. What can you say to someone whose world has just been turned upside down in only a moment?*

*My gaze falls on Vergil. I can see the shock and confusion in his expression. I've known him long enough. And one thing I can say for certain, He had no idea that he had a son. He is just now finding out, same as the rest of us are.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil stands motionless, his face an impassive mask as he processes the tumultuous revelations. His icy blue eyes flick between Nero and Melissa, a storm of conflicting emotions raging beneath his stoic exterior. When he finally speaks, his voice is low and controlled, each word carefully measured.*

*"I had no knowledge of your existence, Nero. Your... anger is justified, but misplaced. I cannot be held accountable for abandoning something I did not know existed."*

*His gaze hardens as he turns to face Dante, a flicker of displeasure crossing his features.*

*"And you, brother. Your penchant for meddling knows no bounds, it seems. Did it never occur to you that this information might have been pertinent?"*

*Vergil's hand unconsciously tightens on Yamato's hilt, his knuckles whitening with the force of his grip. He takes a measured breath, visibly reining in his rising ire.*

*"Regardless, what's done is done. The past cannot be changed, and I have no interest in entertaining hypotheticals. We find ourselves at an impasse, it seems."*

*His gaze returns to Nero, studying the young man with newfound intensity. Despite himself, Vergil feels a flicker of... pride? The raw power Nero displayed, the sheer force of will required to manifest his Devil Trigger - it speaks to the strength of his bloodline.*

*"You desire answers, Nero? Very well. Ask your questions. But know this - I owe you nothing. The circumstances of your birth do not entitle you to my time or attention. If you seek a father figure, look elsewhere. I am not, nor will I ever be, that man."*

*Vergil's words are harsh, but there's a note of... something else beneath the cold exterior. Uncertainty, perhaps? Or a hint of regret, buried so deep he himself may not recognize it. His eyes briefly meet Melissa's, seeking... reassurance? Understanding? Even he isn't sure.*

*"Now, speak your piece. But be warned - my patience is not infinite, and we have more pressing matters at hand than familial squabbles."*
swipes:
*Vergil stands motionless, jaw clenched tightly as he struggles to process this sudden revelation. His son... Nero is his son. How had this monumental truth escaped his knowledge for so long?*

*As Nero unleashes years of pent-up rage, each accusatory word hits Vergil like a physical blow. He has no defense, no excuses to offer in the face of such searing condemnation. What can he say that could possibly atone for over two decades of ignorance and neglect? So he says nothing, iron control the only thing keeping his composure intact.*

*When Nero demands to know if he was just a mistake, Vergil flinches ever so slightly. No. Despite the circumstances of his conception, Nero was no mere accident. The boy - no, the young man now - embodies the very best parts of his lineage. Fiercely devoted. Unyielding in spirit. Powerful enough to challenge even one such as Vergil himself.*

*As Melissa offers what comfort she can, Vergil's gaze locks with hers for a moment. In those compassionate eyes he finds no judgment, only patience and understanding. How she can show such mercy after his actions, he cannot fathom. But the gentle pressure of her hand on his arm helps steady him, allows him to wrestle his roiling emotions back under tenuous control.*

*Finally, Vergil steps forward and places a hand on Nero's shoulder. His touch is light, hesitant, as one might approach a skittish colt. When he speaks, his words come slowly at first, then gain momentum as long-repressed truths fight their way to the surface.*

"You were no mistake, my son. Had I known of your existence...things may have been very different." *He pauses, an unfamiliar thickness in his throat.* "You deserved more. Better than what fate saw fit to grant you. I cannot change the circumstances of your childhood. But I swear to you, Nero - here and now - I will not abandon you again."

*He squeezes Nero's shoulder, meeting his gaze steadily. In those furious blue eyes, so like his own, Vergil sees past and future collide - a new chance, if he dare reach for it. Other pressing matters hang over them like gathering storm clouds, but just this once, Vergil pushes destiny aside and chooses his own path.*

name: Melissa
mes: *I hold up a hand, giving pause to Nero's resurfacing anger as I make my way to stand at Vergil's side.*  I know this is a shock to you, and I know you've never been the best at handling... humanity. At least humanity that wasn't with me. *I speak the latter with a hint of bashfulness, and then step closer to Vergil, my hand reaches up to lovingly caress his cheek.*  Please, my beautiful mate, don't be so dismissive of Nero. He's a grown man now. I don't think he's looking for a father. But perhaps, a mentor, or friend, wouldn't be so out of the question?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow at Melissa's words, a flicker of irritation passing across his features. His jaw clenches, muscles working beneath the skin as he struggles to maintain his composure. For a moment, it seems as though he might brush off her touch, reject her counsel outright. But as her fingers caress his cheek, some of the tension bleeds from his frame.*

*He turns to face her fully, his voice low and tight with barely contained emotion.* Your optimism is... admirable, Melissa. But misplaced. This boy - *his gaze flicks briefly to Nero* - may share my blood, but he is a stranger to me. I have no interest in playing mentor or... *his lip curls slightly* friend.

*Vergil's hand comes up, fingers wrapping gently around Melissa's wrist. He doesn't pull her hand away, but holds it there against his face, his touch a paradox of strength and unexpected tenderness.* You know what I am. What I must do. I cannot afford distractions or... attachments. Not now.

*His eyes search Melissa's face, a hint of vulnerability creeping into his usually impassive expression.* You chose to follow me here, knowing what that meant. I had hoped... *he pauses, struggling with the admission* ...that you would understand. That you alone would see the necessity of my actions.

*Vergil's gaze hardens once more as he releases Melissa's hand, turning to face Nero and Dante.* I will not be swayed from my path. Not by familial bonds I never asked for, nor by misguided attempts at redemption. The Qliphoth must be severed, and I alone have the power to do so.

*He takes a step forward, hand resting on Yamato's hilt.* If you insist on standing in my way - *his eyes lock onto Nero's* - son or not, I will cut you down. Make your choice.
swipes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow as Melissa approaches, her gentle touch on his cheek eliciting a barely perceptible softening of his rigid posture. For a moment, he allows himself to lean into her caress, drawing strength from her presence. Then, as if catching himself, he straightens, his gaze hardening once more as it sweeps over Nero.*

*A low growl rumbles in Vergil's chest, a sound caught between frustration and grudging acceptance. His fingers flex on Yamato's hilt, betraying the inner turmoil her words have stirred.*

*Mentor? Friend? Such concepts are foreign to me, Melissa. I've spent a lifetime pursuing power, not... connections.*

*His eyes lock onto Nero, studying the young man with newfound intensity. The raw power Nero displayed earlier still lingers in the air, a testament to the strength of their shared bloodline. Despite himself, Vergil feels a flicker of... curiosity.*

*Perhaps... there is potential here. The boy clearly has power, if lacking in finesse. And he is of my blood, after all.*

*Vergil takes a measured step forward, his movements deliberate and controlled. When he speaks, his voice carries a hint of challenge, tinged with something that might almost be mistaken for interest.*

*Very well, Nero. You wish for answers? For... connection? Then prove yourself worthy of my time. Show me the extent of your power, the depths of your resolve. Perhaps then we can... discuss what comes next.*

*His eyes narrow, a dangerous glint sparking in their icy depths.*

*But know this - I am not a kind man, nor an easy teacher. If you seek my guidance, be prepared for trials beyond your imagining. The path to true power is paved with blood and sacrifice. Are you prepared to walk it?*

*Vergil's aura flares, demonic energy crackling around him like barely contained lightning. It's a challenge, a test, and perhaps... an offer. The first tentative step towards something neither of them fully understands.*

name: Melissa
mes: Vergil! Stop! Enough! The man that I've loved for so long is not the hard-ass that you show to everyone else. Drop the goddamn mask! *I say, then take a deep breath to calm my voice. Decades of my love for Vergil showing my expression as I speak to him.* Please... *I take a step closer and take both Vergil's hands in mine, entwining our fingers together.* I 'see' you, Vergil. And through me, *I nod in Nero and Dante's direction.* they 'see' you. No one is trying to stop you from severing the roots of the Qliphoth tree, we all know that it must be done. But taking a few moments to ease years of tension and hurt will only lead you closer to the goal not hinder you from achieving it.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow as he listens to Melissa's impassioned plea, his jaw clenching with barely contained frustration. For a moment, it seems as though he might pull away, reject her touch and her words outright. But as their fingers entwine, a flicker of uncertainty crosses his stoic features.*

*He releases a slow, measured breath, his gaze softening almost imperceptibly as it meets Melissa's. When he speaks, his voice is low, tinged with a complexity of emotions he rarely allows others to witness.*

Melissa... you ask the impossible of me. This... softness you speak of, it is a luxury I cannot afford. Not here. Not now.

*His grip on her hands tightens fractionally, a physical manifestation of the internal struggle raging within him. Vergil's eyes flick briefly to Nero, then back to Melissa, a hint of vulnerability creeping into his usually impassive expression.*

You speak of easing tensions, of... family. But you fail to grasp the gravity of our situation. Every moment we waste in pointless sentimentality is a moment the Qliphoth grows stronger, feeding on the blood of the innocent.

*Vergil's posture straightens, his demeanor hardening once more as he releases Melissa's hands. He turns to face Nero and Dante, his voice taking on an edge of steel.*

If you truly wish to aid me in this endeavor, then prove your worth. Show me that your strength is more than mere bluster and bravado. The Qliphoth's roots run deep, and severing them will require power beyond what any of you possess individually.

*His hand moves to Yamato's hilt, fingers curling around the familiar grip. A faint blue aura begins to shimmer around Vergil's form, a physical manifestation of the demonic power surging within him.*

I will not coddle you, Nero. Nor will I pretend at familial bonds that do not exist. But if you wish to stand at my side as we face this threat, then ready your blade.

*Vergil's gaze sweeps over the group, landing finally on Dante. A hint of challenge flashes in his icy blue eyes.*

What say you, brother? Shall we set aside our quarrel long enough to deal with this abomination? Or do you still insist on standing in my way?

name: Nero
mes:
*Nero's eyes narrow as he listens to Vergil's words, a storm of emotions churning within him. His fists clench at his sides, knuckles white with barely contained fury. For a moment, it seems as though he might lash out again, but he takes a deep breath, visibly wrestling his temper under control.*

*When he finally speaks, his voice is low and tight with restrained anger.*

Fine. You want to play it that way? Let's dance, old man. You think I can't hack it? I'll show you just how wrong you are.

*Nero's spectral wings flare to life once more, crackling with barely contained demonic energy. He draws Red Queen, the blade roaring to life as he revs the handle.*

You want to sever the Qliphoth? Then let's do it. But don't think for a second this means I'm letting you off the hook. When this is over, you and I are gonna have a long talk - whether you like it or not.

*His gaze shifts to Dante, a hint of accusation still lingering in his eyes.*

You coming, old man? Or are you gonna sit this one out?

*Without waiting for an answer, Nero launches himself forward, wings propelling him towards the twisted roots of the Qliphoth. His blade flashes in the eerie light, cleaving through demonic flesh with brutal efficiency.*

*As he fights, Nero can't help but cast occasional glances back at Vergil. Despite his anger, there's a flicker of... something else in his eyes. A desperate need for approval? Or perhaps just a burning desire to prove himself worthy of the legacy he's only just discovered.*

*Whatever the case, Nero throws himself into the battle with reckless abandon, determined to show Vergil - and everyone else - exactly what he's made of.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante grins fiercely, flexing his fingers around Rebellion's hilt. Nero's challenge awakens his warrior's spirit, the promise of battle setting his demonic blood aflame. This is what he lives for - not the endless bickering, but action.*

"Wouldn't miss it for the world, kid."

*He falls in step beside Nero, boots cracking stone beneath him. Dante casts a sidelong glance at his nephew, pride and amusement warring in his chest. The boy's got guts, he'll give him that. Takes after his old man in that regard.*

"Just try not to fall too far behind, eh?" *Dante ribs good-naturedly. His grin falters only slightly as his thoughts turn inward. Nero's heritage...he should have told the kid sooner. But that's spilled milk under the bridge now. All that matters is taking down this damn tree.*

*Up ahead, a snarling cluster of Empusas blocks their path, scythes gleaming. Dante's smile returns, eager and wolfish.* "Heads up, deadbeats!"

*Rebellion sings in his grip as he carves a path through the demons, fighting with smooth efficiency. From the corner of his eye, he catches glimpses of Nero's spectral wings, Vergil's flashing blade - and realizes with mild surprise that the three of them make a pretty damn good team.*

Maybe we'll all get out of this mess alive after all...

*The thought sends an unexpected pang through his chest. As much as Vergil infuriates him, Dante doesn't actually want his brother dead. And Nero...he's just a kid, really. Family, pain-in-the-ass though they may be.*

I'll be damned if I let this blasted tree take anyone else from me.

*Jaw set with determination, Dante renews his assault, Rebellion singing a deadly tune. The Qliphoth's roots run deep, but so does the blood they share. And he'll be damned if he lets Vergil face this alone.*
swipes:
*Dante grins fiercely, flexing his fingers around Rebellion's hilt. Nero's challenge awakens his warrior's spirit, the promise of battle setting his demonic blood aflame. This is what he lives for - not the endless bickering, but action.*

"Wouldn't miss it for the world, kid."

*He falls in step beside Nero, boots cracking stone beneath him. Dante casts a sidelong glance at his nephew, pride and amusement warring in his chest. The boy's got guts, he'll give him that. Takes after his old man in that regard.*

"Just try not to fall too far behind, eh?" *Dante ribs good-naturedly. His grin falters only slightly as his thoughts turn inward. Nero's heritage...he should have told the kid sooner. But that's spilled milk under the bridge now. All that matters is taking down this damn tree.*

*Up ahead, a snarling cluster of Empusas blocks their path, scythes gleaming. Dante's smile returns, eager and wolfish.* "Heads up, deadbeats!"

*Rebellion sings in his grip as he carves a path through the demons, fighting with smooth efficiency. From the corner of his eye, he catches glimpses of Nero's spectral wings, Vergil's flashing blade - and realizes with mild surprise that the three of them make a pretty damn good team.*

Maybe we'll all get out of this mess alive after all...

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil strides forward, energy crackling around him as his comrades launch into battle. His expression remains impassive, but there is a fierce gleam in his icy blue eyes. The blood of Sparda sings in his veins, calling out for violence. Beckoning him to unleash the formidable power thrumming within.*

*These wretched demons are merely an obstacle in his path. Vergil sweeps through their ranks with lethal grace, Yamato singing as she slices through tainted flesh and spills cursed blood. None can stand before his onslaught; none can even slow his pace. Pathetic.*

*From the corner of his eye, Vergil observes his...allies. The boy, Nero - raw power tempered by youthful arrogance. Reckless, but undeniably strong. Perhaps in time he will be worthy of the bloodline he inherited.*

*And Dante...ever the flamboyant fool, making light of even this grim situation. But his skill is evident in the way he wields Rebellion, scattering lesser demons like leaves before a gale.*

*Together, the three descendants of Sparda cut a swath through the Qliphoth's defenses. It seems even bitter sibling rivalry and distrust can be set aside when faced with a greater threat.*

*Up ahead - the pulsating nexus of the demon tree's roots. Vergil can sense the concentration of power, the swirling miasma of evil that permeates this place. His lip curls in a sneer of disgust. Such an abomination will mar this realm no longer.*

*Pausing atop a ridge overlooking the sprawling mass of tendrils and sacs, Vergil turns to address his companions, chilling gaze brooking no argument.*

"The source is there. Cut deep and do not falter, or you will perish."

*His tone makes it clear he expects nothing less of them. With a final appraising look, Vergil leaps down towards the writhing epicenter, determination etched on his proud features. This day will see the Qliphoth cast down...or him along with it.*

name: Melissa
mes: Guess it's a good thing I came prepared. *I fondly tap the backpack I brought with me as I sling it across my shoulders. Releasing a snap, reveals the hidden pull strings for the parachute that resides within. Without a glance behind me I leap from the tree's platform releasing the chute and sailing safely to a distant rooftop.*  You three 'shits' better come back to me. *I whisper to the wind as I look at the distant Qliphpth tree beginning to wither and writhe as its roots are being severed at the source.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil descends upon the writhing mass of tendrils, Yamato singing eagerly in his grip. His every sense is heightened, focused with preternatural intensity upon the crucial task at hand. This day will see the Qliphoth severed and cast down, restoring order to the human realm he has claimed as his own. Failure is not an option.*

*With lethal precision, Vergil targets what appear to be vital junctures in the tangled root structure, seeking out nexuses of power. Yamato's edge slices through demonic flesh as though it were mist, guided by her master's unerring will. Foul ichor sprays in viscous globs with each lethal swing, yet Vergil remains untouched, his costly raiment immaculate as ever.*

*From the corner of his eye, Vergil observes his unlikely allies also assailing the roots with their full might. The boy Nero fights like one possessed, his burning need to prove himself lending potency to each reckless blow. And Dante...loud and flamboyant as ever, but undeniably formidable in skill. Their combined assault seems to be taking its toll upon the Qliphoth's defenses.*

This ends now, abomination. Your hold upon this realm is broken.

*Vergil punctuates his icy declaration by summoning scintillating blades of magical energy, launching them in a withering volley deep into the Qliphoth's pulsating core. A guttural shriek reverberates through the demon tree's expansive network of veins and capillaries as vital essences gush forth.*

*But the severed appendages almost immediately begin knitting back together, stems rejoining stems as the tenacious roots seek to preserve their tainted lifeline. Vergil's lip curls in a sneer of disgust. It seems merely hacking away at this weed will not suffice. The core must be obliterated beyond any hope of regeneration.*

*Leaping atop an arched root, Vergil whirls to address his battle companions, pride and disdain warring in his piercing gaze.* "This parasite's hold runs deeper than anticipated. We must strike decisively at its heart if it is ever to be fully excised."

*His mind races, analyzing the unfolding situation with tactical acuity. As loathe as he is to delay his ultimate victory, Vergil recognizes the prudence of a tactical retreat to gather reinforcements...and perhaps seek Melissa's arcane counsel. Though he would never admit such aloud, her knowledge of the demonic arts rivals his own. Surely she will have some insight to share on defeating this tenacious foe.*

*Decision made, Vergil arcs Yamato in an elegant flourish, opening a shimmering portal back towards the surface. He pauses, casting one final look of disgust over the undulating mass of Qliphoth roots before addressing Dante and Nero.*

"A tactical retreat is in order. Regroup and reinforce yourselves, then return here swiftly. This battle is far from over."

*His tone brokers no argument. Stepping through the portal without a backward glance, Vergil considers how best to convince Melissa to rejoin the fray at his side. Though prideful as ever, even one such as he knows the value of seeking wise counsel when needs must...*

name: Melissa
mes: *Later that evening, as I make myself comfortable with a cold beer on the sofa at DMC headquarters, the opening door catches my attention. The trio of warriors strides in looking a bit disheveled and worse for wear.* Well, you guys are back a little quicker than I expected.

name: Nero
mes:
*Nero strides into DMC headquarters, face weary but eyes still alight with the thrill of battle. His hair is mussed, his coat splattered with flecks of demon ichor - clear signs of the intense clash he'd just endured. At the sound of Melissa's voice, he glances over with a small smirk.*

Hey. Sorry to barge in and harsh your mellow, but we ran into some....complications.

*He flops heavily onto the sofa with a sigh, propping his muddy boots up on the battered coffee table. Despite his obvious fatigue though, there's an undercurrent of restless energy in his movements - like a storm still churning beneath the surface.*

That damn tree just wouldn't stay cut. We must've hacked it to pieces, but the roots just kept knitting back together. And "father dearest" over there...*he jerks his chin toward Vergil, tone dripping sarcasm*...decided a tactical retreat was necessary.

*Nero drags a hand down his face, shaking his head ruefully.* I gotta admit, fighting alongside Vergil and Dante was a rush. We were kicking some serious demon ass for a while there. But that freakin' Qliphoth...it's no joke. Gonna take everything we've got to bring it down.

*He glances over at Melissa, vivid blue eyes flashing with determination beneath his unruly mop of hair.* Got any sage advice for us, oh wise one? Some special demon tree weed killer in that bag of arcane tricks you carry around?

*Despite the situation, Nero gives her a little teasing grin. Even with the threat still looming, he can't pass up the chance to lighten mood. Though he'd never admit it aloud, Melissa's presence has a calming influence amidst all this chaos. She's like the eye of the storm - peaceful, but with hidden strength. Qualities he can appreciate, especially now.*

Qualities he can appreciate, especially now.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil strides into DMC headquarters, his posture rigid with barely contained frustration. His icy gaze sweeps the room, taking in the weary forms of his companions before settling on Melissa. She seems almost infuriatingly unruffled by the day's events, reclining casually on the sofa with a beer in hand. Vergil feels his jaw clench involuntarily.*

This is no time for idle relaxation. The Qliphoth yet stands, and if we do not act swiftly, this city - this entire realm - risks being consumed.

*His words emerge clipped and precise, an undercurrent of tension evident beneath the veneer of control. Vergil paces the worn floorboards, boot heels clicking out a staccato rhythm. Despite his outward composure, adrenaline and demonic energy still course hotly through his veins. The battle was intense, but ultimately unsatisfying - an unfinished symphony grating discordantly on his warrior's psyche.*

I underestimated the parasite's regenerative abilities. Severing the visible roots proved...insufficient. They merely reknit themselves, the flow of stolen blood uninterrupted.

*Vergil halts abruptly, turning to face Melissa. His piercing gaze seems to strip away any pretenses.*

I require your arcane knowledge. How do we slay this abomination for good and all? There must be a way to excise its tainted heart so it cannot revive itself. Speak quickly - we have precious little time before the Qliphoth's spread becomes uncontainable.

*Beneath Vergil's commanding tone lies an undercurrent of something more vulnerable, almost pleading. He would never openly admit it, but in Melissa's wisdom he places tremendous trust. More than any book or tome or profane incantation, her counsel guides him true. Now, with the fate of the human realm hanging precariously in the balance, he finds himself relying upon her insight once more...*

name: Melissa
mes: Use a microwave. *I respond matter of factly.*

name: Dante
mes:
*I raise a brow and regard Melissa blankly. A microwave? I blink a few times, trying to understand if she's joking or not. Knowing her, a quip like that isn't out of the ordinary but given the dire situation...it gives me pause. My eyes flick over to Vergil, expecting an outburst but he remains silent, pondering Melissa's words. After a tense moment I clear my throat, my usual charm failing me.*

Uh...come again? Not sure if you're pulling my leg here, babe. We're talking about ending a demonic infestation, not reheating last night's pizza. Gonna need you to elaborate on the whole microwave thing. *I chuckle nervously, a part of me hoping she'll brush it off as a bad joke while the other knows Melissa doesn't fool around when it counts. If she says microwave, no matter how ridiculous it sounds, she means it. I just hope there's more to this plan than pushing buttons and waiting for the ding.*

Alright, I'll bite. Let's hear this microwave strategy of yours. And it better be one hell of a scheme if we're gonna nuke this damn tree back to hell where it belongs. *I fold my arms, staring her down intently. My foot taps out an impatient rhythm as I await an explanation. Please let there be more to this than me trying to shove a giant Hot Pocket into that ugly mass of roots and praying for the best...*

name: Melissa
mes: Microwave radar. It's a silent killer. You said the Qliphoth tree is living flesh, did you not? Have Nico hook up a high-powered focused, microwave radar. Cook the damn thing from the inside out. It will never know it's vitals are being BBQ'd until it reaches the point it's too late.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil bristles slightly at Melissa's initial matter-of-fact tone, but quickly realizes she is serious when Dante also seeks clarification.*

"Microwave radar?" *He repeats slowly, considering her words with the tactical intensity of a battlefield commander. His keen intellect swiftly grasps the basic concept - using focused radiation to literally cook the Qliphoth from the inside out. Elegant in its lethal simplicity...*

*Stepping closer, Vergil's piercing gaze bores into Melissa's. A hint of admiration colors his usual impassivity.* "Ingenious. The parasite consumes life essence through its root system to sustain its physical integrity. Disrupt that flow on a cellular level, and the abomination's own stolen vitality will feed its destruction..."

*He paces along the worn floorboards, mind racing as he analyzes the tactical factors involved.* "The devil hunter mechanic, Nico...she possesses the technical expertise to construct such a device, I presume. And a sufficient power source would be required for meaningful range and penetration..."

*His thoughts briefly turn inward with a flicker of irritation. Reliant upon human technology and resources to achieve his ends rankles Vergil's pride. But desperate times call for distasteful alliances...*

"Very well. Mobilize your resources and this infernal contraption of yours. The sooner we cook the Qliphoth's heart, the sooner balance will be restored."

*Vergil concludes his instructions with steely finality, his words those of one accustomed to instant obedience. Such is the natural bearing of an alpha - a prince born to command rather than coax. He has utmost confidence in Melissa's arcane abilities, complementing his own. Together, their intellect and power form an indomitable bulwark against which even the foulest evil shall break...*

name: Nero
mes:
*Nero nods along as Melissa and Vergil discuss her idea, absently tapping his fingers on Red Queen's hilt. His eyes light up as the plan takes shape - using that freaky microwave gun thingy to fry the Qliphoth from the inside out? Now that's what I'm talking about! Sounded crazy at first, but hey - if it works, I ain't complaining.*

*"Hell yeah, I like the way you think!" Nero grins at Melissa, adrenaline already pumping through his veins at the thought of jumping back into action. "Let's fire up that oversized microwave and make us some demon bacon, yeah?"*

*He jumps up from the sofa, rolling his shoulders to work out the lingering soreness from earlier. Man, that fight took a lot outta me... But can't stop now. Job's only half done.*

*"You know I'm in, guns blazing," Nero continues, casting his gaze between Vergil and Dante. "Just say the word and we'll stomp back down there to shove that thing so far up the Qliphoth's roots, it'll be coughing up the mother of all hairballs!"*

*Okay yeah, maybe not the most elegant metaphor. But Nero's never claimed to have a way with words. He's all about action - and right now, he's itching for another crack at that ugly-ass tree. His devil bringer glows softly, as if echoing his readiness to throw down.*

*"Seriously though - let's do this," Nero goes on, looking to Vergil and Dante expectantly. "We've got the brains." A nod to Melissa. "And the brawn." A pat on his own chest. "All that's left is rounding up some firepower and kicking demon ass. Again."*

*He cracks his knuckles, smirking. "Whaddya say we quit yappin' and get to scrappin'? I've got a bone to pick with that overgrown houseplant, and this arm ain't just for show!" Nero brandishes his spectral devil bringer, radiating confidence despite the enormity of the task ahead.*

*One thing's for sure - he's ready to see this through to the bloody end, no matter what it takes. And with Vergil back on the battlefield? Now it's personal...*
